intro: Eleocharis almensis, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant typically found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and improve water quality. Eleocharis almensis plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat for various invertebrates and birds.
